title: han_chi_ho
body:
South Korean [[Virtual Youtuber]] from [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Nijisanji KR|Korean branch]] and formerly part of [[541 E&C]].

Graduated on April 4, 2022.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4699447

h4. Profile

Chiho is an old Taoist [[wizard]] and legendary storyteller who was sealed in the past and revived in modern times. As a Taoist wizard, Chiho exterminates youkai but he currently only exterminates those that are actively attacking humans. Because of this, Chiho was able to adapt to the streaming environment quickly. Rather than performing his powers, he found that he wanted to adapt quickly to modern culture and fit in with people. He started streaming after finding out that in modern times, one can communicate with people from further away through streaming.

title: anzu_(ensemble_stars!)
body:
The player character of [i][[Ensemble Stars!]][/i].  Will be called [b]Anzu[/b] by default and is referred to as such in the supplementary materials. In-game statements say that she has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

After transferring to Yumenosaki Academy, Anzu becomes the sole female enrolled in the Producer program and is the only female in the school at all. She manages the various idols obtained throughout the game. She's described as a no-nonsense and straightforward girl who's also a workaholic.

It's hinted that she may be the elder sister of the [i][[Ensemble Girls!]][/i] [[protagonist (ensemble girls!)|]], given that her characteristics match what the protagonist says about their sister. 

[spoiler]In truth, she used to be a student in the school from [i]Ensemble Girls![/i], and her pen name was "Angie". She was also friends with [[Kuromori Suzu]]. Anzu was the leader of a resistance which planned to oppose the school's strict methods. After being betrayed by [[Itou Sakura]] and the student council (especially [[Enjouji Reika]]), who encouraged the students to bully Anzu, she was forced to transfer to Yumenosaki, starting the events of [i]Ensemble Stars![/i].[/spoiler]
other_names: あんず(あんさんぶるガールズ!)

title: belldandy
body:
Belldandy is a character in the [[Aa Megami-sama]] manga/anime series. She is the middle of three goddesses who come to Earth to reside with [[Morisato Keiichi]], and serves as his primary love interest. Initially, Keiichi thinks that her offer to grant him a wish was a prank by his senpai so, he makes a joke asking her to stay with him forever. However, Belldandy actually grants the request as a legitimate wish, and soon enough her sisters show up to see what's going on. 

Her older sister is [[Urd (aa megami-sama)|]], although they only share the same father, making them half sisters. Despite that, both she and her younger sister, [[Skuld (aa megami-sama)|]] don't seem to mind that, and treat Urd as if they were full blooded sisters. Belldandy's younger sister looks up to her "oneesama" as Belldandy seems to be the ideal goddess, although it should be noted that despite her sweet and gentle personality, Belldandy can be quite competitive and even shows signs of jealousy whenever someone gets too close to Keiichi. Still, the vast majority of the time, Belldandy remains calm and also displays a rather mature personality, even more so than some of the older goddesses and demons in the series.

Voiced by [[Inoue Kikuko]].

h4. See also
* [[Verdandi]], one of the Norns in Norse mythology which inspired Belldandy.

title: blue_cheese
body:
Any variety of cheese that incorporates edible mold. 

Easily identifiable by the spots of blue mold on the interior or exterior of the cheese.

title: neck_flap
body:
Headwear with a flap on the back; also called a flap cap or a neck cape. 

Typically used as a sunshield in everyday use. Specialized headgear may also cover protection against rain, wind and debris.

title: soviet_school_uniform
body:
A [[Soviet]] era girls' [[school uniform]], in use from 1949 to 1992 (after 1984 only for those under 16). Easily mistaken by outsiders as a maid uniform.

Usually accompanied by white frilly bows, and a [[Pioneer neckerchief]], which almost all schoolchildren under the age of 14 wore.

* "IRL photo":[https://twitter.com/rxs318/status/1384841646383247364]

title: mushroom_cloud
body:
A large distinctive mushroom-shaped cloud of debris/smoke and commonly water vapor from a large-scale scale explosion.

Most commonly associated with [[nuclear weapon]]s, but can also be caused by conventional explosives of significant power and natural events like certain types of volcanic eruptions and impact events.

If the explosion were implied to be caused by nuclear device, or that the typical characteristic of nuclear explosion were present (such as superheated atmosphere), also apply the tag [[nuclear explosion]].

title: nuclear_powerplant
body:
A thermal [[power plant]] in which the heat source is a [[radiation_symbol|nuclear]] reactor. 

As is typical of thermal power stations, heat is used to generate [[steam]] that drives a [[steam]] turbine connected to a generator that produces [[electricity]].

title: breakdance
body:
A style of acrobatic dancing originating in the mid-1970s, often performed to rap music usually by teenage males in the streets, and characterized by intricate footwork, pantomime, spinning headstands, tumbling, and elaborate improvised virtuosic movements.

Became an official sport during the [[2024 summer olympics|Paris Olympics]] under the name "breaking." Canada's Philip "Phil Wizard" Kim and Japan's Yuasa Ami won gold medals in their respective events.

title: roundel
body:
A typically circular symbol. The term is used in heraldry, but also commonly used to refer to a type of national insignia used on [[military]] [[aircraft]], generally circular in shape and usually comprising concentric rings of different colours.

Notable examples:

* United States has circle with a white star, with two white or white-and-red bars on the left and right side.
* Japan has a single red circle, mostly bordered with white stylized after the Japanese flag.
* Germany has a black [[iron cross]] with white borders.
* Britain has a blue, white, and red circle.
** Canada, Australia, and New Zealand replace the circle with a maple leaf, a kangaroo, and a kiwi bird respectively.
* France has a red, white, and blue circle.
* Italy has a red, white, and green circle. During World War II, it has white circle bordered in black with three black fasces in it.
* Soviet Union had a five-pointed [[red star]] with white border. Belarus also uses this roundel after the collapse of the USSR, while Russia added blue border between the white and red section.
* China also has a red star, but with a Chinese text meaning "8.1" and bordered by two red yellow-bordered bars.
* Taiwan and the former Republic of China uses [[Kuomintag]] "white sun" symbol" contained within blue circle.
* Sweden has a blue circle bordered in yellow with three gold crowns in it.
* Poland has a red and white checkerboard design.
* South Korea has a red and blue yin-yang bordered with three black bars on either side.
* Israel has a blue six-pointed star on a white circle.
* Indonesia has a white red-bordered pentagon design.
* The Philippines has a blue, white, and red diamond with wings.
* Finland has a white, blue, and white circle design. Formerly, they used a blue swastika on a white circle.


h4. See Also
* [[Balkenkreuz]]
* [[Nose Art]]
* [[Red Star]]
* [[Rising Sun Flag]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Roundel":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roundel

title: armageddon_bomb
body:
Lit. "Planet Destruction Bomb"

A "gadget" from [[Doraemon]]. Essentially an [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] that [[Doraemon (character)|]] occasionally brings out when he goes mad or insane (especially when he sees a [[rat]]). Primarily serves as comic relief within the series.

Since the bomb only rarely appears, it's never explained why Doraemon possesses such a weapon despite that fact that he is supposed to be a "babysitting robot". The bomb is also never used in any more serious situations (such as life-threatening moments in the various Doraemon movies), mainly due to the kid-oriented theme of the series.

On Danbooru, the bomb is tagged as a [[nuclear weapon]], because when "the manga chapter":[http://doraemon.wikia.com/wiki/Chapter_115:Mouse_And_Bomb] was first serialized in 1974, the gadget was actually called a nuclear bomb.

title: it_should_have_been_me_not_him_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a scene from the English dubbed version of the [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters|Duel Monsters]] anime. The original scenes involves [[Yami Yugi]] dejectedly beating the ground and shouts "It should have been me, not him! It's not fair!", blaming himself for losing the shadow duel to [[Rafael (Yu-Gi-Oh!)|]] and causing the soul of [[Muto Yugi]] to be sealed inside the card instead of him.

While the context of the original scene is that Yami Yugi is blaming himself for Yugi being punished by his failure, in meme context, the character is instead being shown to be [[envy|envious]] of someone's good fortune.

title: shuumatsu_nani_shitemasu_ka?
body:
[i]Shuumatsu Nani Shitemasu ka? Isogashii desu ka? Sukutte Moratte Ii desu ka?[/i]; abbr. [i]Sukasuka[/i] is a Japanese light novel series written by Kareno Akira and illustrated by [[ue]].

A sequel series, [i]終末なにしてますか？ もう一度だけ、会えますか？[/i] ([i]Shuumatsu Nani shitemasu ka? Mou Ichido dake, Aemasu ka?[/i]; abbr. [i]Sukamoka[/i]) started in April 2016.

Although the series' english cover text is "Do you have what THE END? Are you busy? Shall you save XXX?", a more accurate translation of the title would be "What are you doing at THE END? Are you busy? Will you save me?"

A manga adaption by [[Seu Kaname]] started in July 2016.

An anime adaption by Satelight aired in April 2017.

* [[Willem Kmetsch]]

Preceded by the 8-bit [[Sega Master System]] and succeeded by the [[Sega Saturn]].

title: pogo_stick
body:
A jumping device made of a metallic stick with springs somewhere inside, and two footrests at the stick's base. Users stand on the footrests and use the springs to create a bouncing motion. The origins of the word 'pogo' is debated, but it's possible that its modern-version inventors Hans Pohlig and Ernst Gottschall (1920, Germany) combined the first two letters of their surnames to create the word.

Some modern designs have modified the springs or even replaced them altogether, such as with compressed air or a bow mechanism, and have achieved jumping heights of 6 feet or more (1.8 meter+).  This has lead to the growth of using pogo sticks in an extreme sport and the development of the sport "extreme pogo" or "xPogo."

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pogo stick":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pogo_stick

title: charlotte_(madoka_magica)
body:
[[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] character.

The [[witch_(madoka_magica)|witch]] that [[Tomoe Mami]] battles [spoiler]and lost[/spoiler] in episode 3, and has two forms; the first is a limp stuffed doll-like creature wearing a cape, the second is a massive black worm with multicolored eyes.

Charlotte is a dessert witch who is capable of creating infinite amounts of any dessert she desires, but is unable to make the [[cheese]] that she loves most. One could easily catch her off-guard with a piece of cheese. She is also very tenacious, and never gives up. Charlotte's minions are [[pyotr (madoka magica)|Pyotr]].

[spoiler]It is confirmed that [[Momoe Nagisa]], a character introduced in the third movie, is Charlotte's human form.[/spoiler]

h4. See also

In popular culture, [i]Dennis the Menace[/i]'s dog Ruff is a Briard. Also, [[Chewbacca]] from [[Star Wars]] fame was modeled after the Briard.

title: mahou_no_princess_minky_momo
body:
A manga and anime series written by [[Shudo Takeshi]] starring [[Minky Momo]], a [[magical girl]] who does not fight against villains but rather gives people hope and dreams with her magic. The series is divided into two eras: the "Sora Momo" (空モモ - Sky Momo) series that aired in 1982, and the "Umi Momo" (海モモ - Sea Momo) series that aired in 1991. The two Minky Momos look the same, but are completely different.

The series became infamous after the airing of episode 46 of the first season, in which Minky Momo dies after being hit by a truck. Soon after that, an urban legend arose that this episode caused earthquakes across Japan.

title: round_teeth
body:
A wide, [[open mouth|open-mouthed]] [[smile]] where the front [[upper teeth only|upper teeth]] are drawn as a single round semicircle.

Often, it is reserved for depictions of youthfulness, playful personality, and innocence, and is very often a recurring physical trait in certain characters (as with [[Mizuno Kaede]] and [[Aoi Sora (pairan)|]]). However, it is common enough that it might show up without any qualifiers.

Differs from [[buck teeth]] in that buck teeth describes only the two upper front teeth, or a something that resembles just those two front teeth, while round teeth describes the entire row of front upper teeth.

h4. Examples

* !post #2091083
* !post #3775180

h4. See also

* [[teeth]]
* [[grin]]
* [[buck teeth]]

It is probably best known for giving [[Misty (pokemon)|]] a skimpier outfit (a black [[highleg one-piece swimsuit|highleg]] [[slingshot swimsuit]] that was later censored as a wetsuit in English versions) and significantly larger breasts.

body:
A form-fitting garment, worn around the waist and fastened with laces.

True corsets provide back support with sturdy columns of steel or (historically) whalebone and may be cinched to compress the abdomen for a [[curvy]] figure. Corsets were traditionally considered underwear, but in modern times are sometimes worn above the clothing, particularly in fetish fashion. Many such outerwear corsets have flimsy or no boning and thus are not rigid enough to support or reshape the body.

Corsets are usually an [[underbust]] garment, covering only the stomach and waist, but overbust designs for breast support also exist.

Not to be confused with the similar-looking [[bodice]], which reaches up to or over the breasts and often has sleeves or arm holes.

The skirt should not be [[skirt lift|lifted up]] or out of place; the thighs should be exposed naturally, by the skirt being too short to cover the tops of the thighhighs. Example characters include [[Tohsaka Rin]], [[Momose Kurumi]] and [[Mayura]]. 

The term itself originates from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], although it had none of the current connotations in the anime. The modern usage of zettai ryouiki originates from the creator of a desktop mascot application when he used the term on his blog in reference to [[Mayura]].

title: little_boy_(bomb)
body:
A uranium-infused [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] developed by the United States as a part of the Manhattan Project. It was used during the [[atomic bombings of hiroshima and nagasaki|Atomic Bombing of Hiroshima]] on 6 August, 1945, destroying the city in the process. Little Boy is the first nuclear weapon to ever be used in warfare.

Little Boy can be distinguished from its relative [[Fat Man (bomb)|]] by the more cylindrical shape of the bomb casing, as opposed to the more round shape of Fat Man's.

h4. See also
* [[Fat Man (bomb)]]

title: hashima_island

title: nagasaki
body:
A mountainous coastal city in southern island of Kyushu, [[Japan]], being the capital of the namesake prefecture. The city is a historical trading hub during the 16th century and being one of the earliest hubs of [[Christianity]] in the country.

It was the second city attacked during the [[Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki]] that ended [[World War II]]. The bombing ocurred in August 9, 1945. The [[B-29 superfortress]] [[bomber]] [i]Bockscar[/i] dropped the atomic bomb "[[Fat Man (bomb)|]]", a 5 short ton Plutonium device with a blast yield of 21 kilotons, in the early morning of that day.

h4.See also

* [[Hiroshima]]

title: school_bag
body:
A catchall tag for school [[bag]]s used by Japanese students. There are two major styles: the traditional style, which looks like a [[briefcase]], and the modern style, which looks like a small blue [[shoulder bag]].

The traditional style, used by middle and high school students, looks like a [[briefcase]] with a rigid flat front and back, and a single large flap that goes over the top with a handle on the top. It may also have a shoulder strap, but this is rarely depicted. Additionally, this style of bag can also have a strap fastened on the back and can be worn like a [[backpack]].

The modern style looks like a small blue sports bag or duffel bag, with a zipper on the top and a strap on each side. The straps are typically big enough to be worn over the shoulder like a [[shoulder bag]], or sometimes on the back like a [[backpack]].

[[Randoseru]] ([[backpack]]s used by elementary school students) should not be tagged [[school bag]].

h4. Examples

* !post #5230194: Modern style
* !post #2097068: Traditional style

title: survivor_guilt
body:
A type of [[PTSD]] found in person who have survived a life-threatening situation. Individuals who believe it is unfair that they survived when others died and/or believe they did not do enough to save the lives of others may come to experience survivor guilt after trauma or a catastrophic event.

Symptoms of survivor guilt typically include nightmares, difficulty sleeping, flashbacks to the traumatic event, loss of motivation, irritability, a sense of numbness, and thoughts about the meaning of life.

title: mxy-7_ohka
body:
The [b]Yokosuka MXY-7 [i]Ohka ([[cherry_blossoms|Cherry Blossom]])[/i][/b] was a rocket-powered, single-pilot, suicide [[rocket]] flying bomb employed by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] during late [[World War II]]. It was flown by [[kamikaze pilot]]s.

Relatively simple to manufacture, and requiring only minimally-trained operators, this "rocket with a cockpit" was extremely hard to shoot down due to its very high speed. Though due to its limited range, the Ohka was usually carried by the slow and large [[G4M]] bombers, which severely limited its effectiveness, as many G4Ms were shot down before being able to deliver the vehicle.

American soldiers nicknamed this aircraft the [i]"Baka"[/i] (literally "idiot" in Japanese).

h4. See also
* [[Kaiten (weapon)]]
* [[The Cockpit: Sonic Boom Squadron]]

body:
The [b]Shenyang J-31[/b], rumored to be nicknamed "Gyrfalcon" (鹘鹰), or [i]Falcon Eagle[/i] by some military enthusiasts, is a twin-engine, mid-size fifth-generation fighter [[jet]]  currently under development by [i]Shenyang Aircraft Corporation[/i] for the [[People's Liberation Army Air Force]]. 

The fighter has also been referred to as [b]F-60[/b] (Official Chinese military code name of the export variant) or [b]J-21 Snowy Owl[/b] (雪鸮) in some International media reports.

It is very similar to the American [[F-35 Lightning II]], but is equipped with two engines instead of one and lacks any [[VTOL]] capacity.

title: battle_of_stalingrad
body:
[b]The Battle of Stalingrad[/b] was a major [[battle]] on the Eastern Front of [[World War II]] where [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] and its allies unsuccessfully fought the [[Soviet Union]] for control of the city of Stalingrad (later renamed Volgograd) in Southern [[Russia]]. 

The battle was marked by fierce close-quarters combat and direct assaults on civilians in air raids, with the battle epitomizing urban warfare. It was the deadliest battle of the Second World War in terms of military casualties, with both sides suffering enormous casualties of over 2 million in total. It was also one of, if not, the deadliest battle in history of warfare, with the Siege of Leningrad (also during WWII) being another contender.

Today, the Battle of Stalingrad is universally regarded as the turning point in the European theatre of war, as it forced the Oberkommando der [[Wehrmacht]] (German High Command) to withdraw considerable military forces from other areas in occupied Europe to replace German losses on the Eastern Front, ending with the rout of the six field armies of Army Group B, including the destruction of Nazi Germany's 6th Army (more than a million men) and an entire corps of its 4th Panzer Army. Out of the nearly 91,000 German prisoners captured in Stalingrad, only about 5,000 were returned alive years later in 1955.

This victory, along with the latter [[Battle of Kursk]], energized the [[soviet_army|Red Army]] and shifted the balance of power in the favour of the Soviets for the rest of the war.

h4. See also

* [[Enemy At The Gates]]

* [[Vasily Zaytsev]]
other_names: スターリングラード攻防戦

title: battle_of_kursk
body:
[b]The Battle of Kursk[/b] was a major [[World War II]] Eastern Front large-scale battle between the forces of [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] and the [[Soviet]] Union in the area around the city of "Kursk":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kursk in southwestern [[Russia]] during the late summer of 1943.

The operation ultimately became the largest [[tank]] [[battle]], as well as the largest battle in history of warfare. The Soviet ultimately became victorious, and managed to halt the German advance, eventually gained momentum for subsequent the counter-offensive.

It is considered by some historians to be the turning point of the European theatre of war instead of the [[Battle of Stalingrad]] several months earlier.

title: zangief
body:
[b]Zangief[/b] is a video game character created by [[Capcom]]. He is part of the [[Street Fighter]] series of fighting games, first starring in [[Street Fighter II (series)|]].

Zangief is a Soviet/Russian wrestler nicknamed the "Red Cyclone" who is notable for his bombastic patriotism and obsession with muscle gain. He is [[muscular male|highly muscular]], with [[brown hair|brown]] [[mohawk]] and thick [[chest hair]], with numerous [[scar]] across his body. His wrestling attire consists of a simple red wrestling pants.

His signature fighting style is close-up and [[wrestler]] based, with devastating throws and powerful base moves. This makes him tough up close, though often has trouble with foes with projectiles. Zangief's fighting style would later be known in the fighting game community as "grappler", and he is considered the very first grappler in the fighting game history.

title: nobi_nobita
body:
The deuteragonist of [i][[Doraemon]][/i].

A lazy boy who will put anything he's not interested on hold until it's too late, which resulted into his family's doomed life in the future. Thus, his great grandson sent [[Doraemon (character)|Doraemon]] back to the past to help him to become a responsible man. He usually wears thick rounded [[glasses]], a [[yellow shirt|yellow]] [[polo shirt]], and [[blue pants|blue]] [[shorts]].

Despite his seemingly terrible responsibility and intelligence (as seen by a running gag about him almost always getting a score of 0 on his monthly exams), he can turn into a very dependable person when someone needs help. He's also notable for his amazing sharpshooting skill.

h4. See also

title: burning_at_the_stake
body:
An [[execution]] method involving [[burning]] the condemned alive. It has a long history as a form of capital punishment, and many societies have employed it for criminal activities such as treason, heresy and witchcraft.

The best-known execution of this type is burning at the stake, where the condemned is bound to a large wooden stake and a fire lit beneath them.

Perhaps the most infamous case of this execution method is when it was used to kill Jeanne d'Arc/[[Joan of Arc]].

title: executioner's_sword
body:
An [[executioner]]'s sword is a [[sword]] whose blade is almost completely rectangular--the end does not curve to a tip or form a point, but simply ends rather suddenly, as shown "here":http://getasword.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/executioner-sword.jpg. Such blades were usually used for ceremonial purposes or [[execution]]s (hence the name).

Swords like these are typically western in design, and should not be confused with weapons like the "khanda":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khanda_%28sword%29, a sword from India that [i]was[/i] actually meant to be used in battle.

Despite the historically ceremonial/special-use nature of an executioner's sword, this has not stopped them from being occasionally portrayed as legitimate weapons in media and fanart.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Executioner%27s_sword]
other_names: エグゼキューショナーズソード
エクセキューショナーズソード

title: execution
body:
A legal or otherwise enforced method of killing someone, usually as punishment for a crime. 

Typically the condemned is helplessly [[tied up (nonsexual)|bound]] so that he/she cannot escape. The execution is performed by an [[executioner]] using various methods.

The actual execution need not have been carried out according to the image, so long as the subject will die if the situation persists and no outside forces intervene. In this case the image should also have the [[peril]] tag. Alternatively, if the execution has been carried out, the image should include [[death]] and, if the scene is bloody and/or gory, [[guro]] as well.

Preferably, this tag should be used when the situation depicted is that of a currently or previously used form of legal execution, including but not limited to:

* [[burning at the stake]]
* [[crucifixion]]
* [[decapitation]]
* [[electric chair]]
* [[firing squad]]
* [[gas chamber]]
* [[guillotine]]
* [[hanged]]
* lethal [[injection]]

title: double_suicide
body: Shinju refers to any [[suicide]] of two or more individuals who are "bound by love". There was a belief stemming from Edo teachings that [[couple|lovers]] who comitted double suicide would be united in the afterlife. The word is formed from 心 (heart/mind) and 中 (center/inside). As such, its literal definition could be the "oneness of hearts".

body:

Unlike the first season, players now recieve a randomized life count. On their final life, they must cut ties with all other players and become hostile. Players are also able to give up a life for another person, or reveal their life count to someone.

This season introduces three new players, being [[PearlescentMoon]], [[mumbo jumbo (youtuber)|Mumbo Jumbo]], and [[LDShadowLady]].

title: hello_kitty
body:
Hello Kitty is a friendly white kitty with the head larger than her body, small button eyes and nose, but [[no mouth]]. She is said to be five apples tall and the weight of three apples.

She was created by Yuko Shimizu and developed by Sanrio into global advertising phenomenon worth billions of dollars. Hello Kitty is a staple of the [i]kawaii[/i] segment of Japanese pop culture and is marketed to all ages.

For information on Hello Kitty herself, see [[Hello Kitty (character)]].

title: nisemonogatari
body:
Nisemonogatari is a series of light novels by Nisioisin, with drawings by [[Vofan]]. It is the sequel to [[Bakemonogatari]]. It was made into an anime by [[Shaft (company)|]] and released on January 8, 2012.

The story follows the two sisters of [[Araragi Koyomi]], [[Araragi Karen]] and [[Araragi Tsukihi]], as they try to prevent the same oddity that cursed [[Senjougahara Hitagi]] from spreading further chaos.

Wielder of the Nine Realm Harp, she is a musician who can hear the music of all living things, spinning them into an ethereal melody. Her songs are said to be capable of bringing an entire army to their knees, but she simply wishes to find those with beautiful melodies.

title: niyon_(lejonskrik)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:

All the pitiful prey in the world know to cower before the mighty lion, whose mane gleams gold and whose claws rip without mercy. Full of pride, it roars to announce its place at the top of the food chain. One brave magical harpist attunes herself to the melody of the mighty lion, readying herself to attend a banquet of illusions.

body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character and one of the Eternals.

Her name in Japanese is "ソーン", which has earned a number of different romanizations in the English speaking community, including Song, Sorn, and Thorn. In particular, "Song" means "two" in Thai and Lao, fitting with the number based naming theme of the rest of the Eternals.

The wielder of the Two Crown Bow. [[Tweyen_(granblue_fantasy)|]] was born with incredible eyesight, being able to spot objects unassisted from miles away. This, combined with her ability to fire magical arrows, has made her a legendary archer. However, she worries her that her strength may have only brought her loneliness, especially after it sparked an incident that separated her from her dearest friend...

She is close friends with [[Silva_(granblue_fantasy)|]].

Voiced by [[Minaguchi Yuuko]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3210465: [[Tweyen_(eternal's_summer_vacation)_(granblue_fantasy)|Eternal's Summer Vacation]]

title: lobelia_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character and one of the members of the Evokers. The shrewd Magician, pact bearer to the Arcarum primal beast [[The Tower (granblue fantasy)|]]. 

In his youngest days this magician found happiness in the sound of destruction. A natural genius turned natural disaster, he used his power to lay low other people and lands, trapping the sounds that result. In the aftermath, he discovers true happiness. Born to destruction and living within it, the magician is satisfied by the happy sound of his own destruction, which rings out with a tune of eternal torment.

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Lobelia":https://gbf.wiki/Lobelia

title: yuigaoka_music_program_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by the students attending the special music program at the Yuigaoka Girls' High School in [[Love Live! Superstar!!]].

The [[winter uniform|winter]] version is very similar to the regular uniform and consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] worn under a [[short dress|short]] [[grey dress|grey]] [[pinafore dress]], with the main difference from the regular uniform being that it has a [[red bowtie]] instead of a neck ribbon and a [[double-breasted]] [[white jacket]] instead of the blue blazer. 

The [[summer uniform|summer]] version is quite different and is a more traditional [[serafuku|]] with a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[sailor shirt]], a [[grey sailor collar]] and a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[grey skirt|grey]] [[miniskirt]].

h4. Examples
* !post #5708564: Winter uniform
* !post #4847638: Summer uniform

h4. See also

* [[Yuigaoka school uniform]]

title: unofficial_precure_costume
body:
Unofficial designs for the different uniforms worn throughout the [[Precure]] franchise. Unlike with [[unofficial Sailor Senshi uniform]], which just has one base design, Precure has multiple uniform designs for its main Cures and some villain teams. This is why the tag uses the term [i]costume[/i] rather than [i]uniform[/i] so that all of the designs for each series can be covered here.

This shouldn’t include merely an alternate color or an adaptation of an existing costume. The designs for both the character and clothing should be entirely different and not canon. This is usually depicted with fan designs for characters who never become Cures wearing their own unique adaptation of an existing uniform. It is possible for an existing Cure to [[cosplay]] as another one to the point of changing their hairstyle and adding/reducing embellishments to match the character they’re cosplaying. Another possibility is a [[light persona]] or [[dark persona]] being depicted in a fan made uniform based off of an existing one.

This tag could go hand-in-hand with [[alternate universe]] if it is a full-on scene of a fanmade character design interacting with canon characters, rather than a character just standing there showing off an outfit (post #1400262).

Consider adding [[in-franchise crossover]] if the fan design for one series’ Cure(s) is directly based off of another series’ Cure(s). For instance, post #5092919 has [[Futari wa Precure]] characters wearing adapted costumes based off of [[Mahou Girls Precure!]].

title: baraduke
body:
[b]Baraduke[/b] (バラデューク [i]Baradyūku[/i]), also known as [b]Alien Sector[/b] in the western world, is a 2D scrolling [[science fiction]] shooter arcade [[video game]] that was released by [[Namco]] in 1985. It runs on Namco Pac-Land hardware but with a video system like that used in Metro-Cross and Dragon Buster. 

The game is notable because [[Toby Masuyo]], one of its main protagonists, predates by one year [[Samus Aran]] from [[Metroid]] as a human female playable character.

h4. See also

* [[Paccet]]

body:

A pair of beamed sixteenth notes looks like this: ♬

title: pachikar
body:
A minor NPC in [[Toushin Toshi II]], and a boss character in its remake, [[Toushin Toshi Girls Gift]].

In the original game, Pachikar is a pessimistic, low-ranking [[angel]] who spends her time at a desk stamping documents, lamenting that she never does anything fun in her life. In Girl's Gift, however, her character is completely overhauled, as she is now a hot-blooded Angel Knight with a strong will, known by the epithet "Fist Angel" due to using a pair of red [[boxing gloves]] for weapons.

Her design in the original game featured Pachikar with [[short hair|short]], [[orange hair]] and [[orange eyes]], wearing a [[white dress]]. In Girls Gift, Pachikar's design is altered to give her [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]], and she now wears a blue and white [[halterneck]] with large, golden [[wristband]]s adorned with the [[venus symbol|Venus]] and [[Mars symbol|Mars]] symbols. She also wears a [[white skirt]].

title: help:pools
body:
Pools are ordered collection of related images. Unlike [[help:tags|tags]] or [[help:post relationships|parent/child relationships]], the posts in a pool have a specific order.

Pools are typically for series of related images, such as [[comic]]s or sets of related images by an artist. These pools are called [b]series[/b] pools and have purple-colored names.

Another use of pools is for collections of posts that share a common, subjective theme. These pools are called [b]collection[/b] pools and have blue-colored names. Some of these pools are organized under the [[pool groups]] page.

h4. Rules

* Don't create pools for personal collections of your favorite posts. Use [[help:favorite groups|favorite groups]] for that. Personal pools will be subject to deletion in topic #8282.
* Avoid creating collection pools when a tag would do.

h4. Howto

h6. Name a pool

Series pool names should generally follow the format "Copyright - Title (Artist)". 

* If the pool spans multiple series, you can use "Various" as the copyright.
* If the pool contains images by multiple artists, you can use "various artists".
* If the pool has an unknown artist (e.g., for official art pools), you can omit the artist part.
* If the pool title is not English, you can either translate it or use the original language title. Unicode characters are supported in pool names. 
* If the artist has not given a title to the series, try to pick something relevant to the series.
* If the pool is a sample of a series, add [sample] after the title.

h6. Create a pool

Go to the "Pools":/pools page in the top menu, then click on "New":/pools/new in the top submenu. Type the name of the pool, set its category, and write a description of it. Click submit to create the pool.

Alternatively, you can tag a post with [code]newpool:name[/code], where [code]name[/code] is the name of the new pool.

h6. Add posts to a pool

Click on [b]Add to pool[/b] from the post's page. A window will pop up where you can search for the pool you want by typing part of its name.

Alternatively, you can tag a post with [code]pool:<name>[/code] to add it to a pool. For example, to add a post to the "Disgustingly Adorable":/pools/903 pool, you could tag the post with {{pool:Disgustingly_Adorable}} or {{pool:903}}.

Lastly, you can go to the pool's [b]Edit[/b] page, then add the post's ID in the [b]Posts[/b] field.

h6. Remove posts from a pool

Go to the pool's [b]Edit[/b] page, search for the post's ID in the [b]Posts[/b] field, and remove the ID from the list.

Alternatively, you can tag a post with [code]-pool:<name>[/code] to remove it from a pool. For example, to remove a post from the "Disgustingly Adorable":/pools/3550 pool, you could tag the post with {{-pool:Disgustingly_Adorable}} or {{-pool:903}}.

h6. Modify a pool's order

Click the [b]Order[/b] link at the top of the page while viewing the pool. You can then drag and drop the posts into the correct order.

For pools with over 1000 posts, the [b]Order[/b] link will not appear. To order these large pools, you should instead go to the pool's [b]Edit[/b] page, search for the IDs of the posts you want to reorder in the [b]Posts[/b] field, and reorder them within that text field.

h6. Rename a pool

Go to the pool's [b]Edit[/b] page, change the [b]Name[/b] field, then click save.

h6. Delete a pool

Go to the pool's [b]Edit[/b] page, then click the [b]Delete[/b] link in the top menu, then click the confirm button. To undelete a pool, click the [b]Undelete[/b] button. Pools can be safely deleted and undeleted with no loss of information.

Deleting and undeleting pools may only be performed by Builder-level users and above.

h4. See also

* [[Pool Groups]]
* [[Help:Post Relationships]]
* Topic #8282 (Pointless Pools)

title: respirator
body:
A half-face [[mask]] that covers the nose and mouth and uses a filter to protect the wearer from inhaling harmful dust, fumes, vapors, or gases.

If the mask covers the eyes, then it's a [[gas mask]], not a respirator.

h4. Examples

* !post #7400500
* !post #1146908

h4. See also

* [[gas mask]]
* [[oxygen mask]]

title: gas_mask
body:
A full-face [[mask]] that protects the wearer from toxic gases and airborne pollutants by covering their nose, mouth, and eyes. 

They protect the wearer by forming a sealed cover over the nose and mouth and filters the air that they breath in to prevent inhaling toxic gases or pollutants. The mask also protects the eyes from exposure to toxic gases or pollutants that may cause irritation, temporary blindness, or even permanent eye damage. 

If the mask doesn't cover the eyes, then it's a [[respirator]], not a [[gas mask]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #22763215
* !post #5156782

h4. See also

* [[respirator]]
* [[oxygen mask]]

title: surgical_mask
body:
A [[mouth mask]] of the type worn by [[doctor]]s and [[nurse]]s to prevent the spread of bacteria from the wearer's mouth and nose.  It is composed of a rectangular piece of cloth with several horizontal folds to allow it to stretch over the mouth and nose.

This term refers to two similar types of medical masks, a [i]procedure mask[/i] and [i]surgical mask[/i]. Procedure masks may not be sterile and fasten by looping around the ears; used when carrying out general medical procedures like a check-up. Surgical masks are sterile and are fastened by bands that loop around the head; used when carrying out surgeries.

In Japan, it is common to wear a face mask whilst ill to avoid infecting others in public settings. During the [[coronavirus pandemic]], it became common to wear masks worldwide.

They are also worn by delinquents, from school renegades to [[bousouzoku]] and the [[yakuza]]. 

h4. Examples

* !post #4047059

h4. See also

* [[Fellatio under mask]]
* [[Mask around one ear]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Surgical mask":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surgical_mask]

body:
A [b]Destroyer[/b] is a type of medium-sized (smaller than most cruisers including lights but larger than a corvette or frigate)  [[warship]] designed for interception, torpedo attack, long-range patrol, and defense of larger capital ships including Battleships and Carriers.

Although originally designed for the distinct purpose of hunting torpedo boats, destroyers have become for the past 80 years, the most common large warships still operated by bluewater navies today.

title: jacques_schnee
body:
A major antagonist of [[rwby|RWBY]]. CEO of the Schnee Dust Company, along with being the husband of [[Willow Schnee|]] and the father of [[Weiss Schnee|]], [[Winter Schnee|]] and [[Whitley Schnee|]]. A callous and manipulative businessman, his amoral actions have given the company a bad reputation and driven his wife into alcoholism. He is the arch-enemy to Weiss, who actively works to restore the previous and better reputation of the company.

[spoilers]In Volume 7, Jacques wins the election for councilman after rigging the votes, with help from [[Arthur Watts|]]. However, his treachery is found and revealed by his own daughter and Jacques is arrested for his crimes. During the conclusion of Volume 8, he is murdered by [[James Ironwood]].[/spoilers]

body:
A major antagonist in the Rooster Teeth series [[RWBY]].

h4. Abilities
Cinder can produce and control fire. She also wields a variety of weapons including [[sword]]s, a [[bow]] and a [[spear]].

h4. Physical characteristics
Cinder is 5'11" tall including high heels. She has [[black hair]] and [[yellow_eyes|amber eyes]]. [spoiler]After suffering major injury at the end of Volume 3, she is thereafter missing an [[missing_limb|arm]] and an [[one-eyed|eye]] and has a large [[scar_on_face|scar]] on the left side of her face. [/spoiler]

title: nora_valkyrie
body:
Nora Valkyrie is a supporting character in [[RWBY]], a 3DCG series produced by Rooster Teeth.

Nora is a member of Team JNPR, and is the "N" in the team's name. She is highly energetic and has a bouncy, cheerful personality. Her design and abilities are inspired by Thor.

h4. Abilities 

Nora wields [[Magnhild]], a weapon that can transform between a large two-handed hammer and a revolver-action grenade launcher. Her symbol is a hammer with a lightning bolt through it. Her semblance (special ability) allows her to absorb electrical energy and convert it to a temporary strength boost.

h4. Physical characteristics

Nora is short (5' 1") and curvy, and has [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] and greenish eyes.

[spoiler]As of volume 8 episode 3, her arms and upper body are covered in [[Lichtenberg figure]]-shaped scars.[/spoiler]

h4. Attire

Nora usually wears pink and white clothing accented with black and/or blue. In addition to her hammer and lightning symbol, her outfits often incorporate one or more heart-shaped designs. Most of her outfits include a short skirt.

h4. External links

https://rwby.fandom.com/wiki/Nora_Valkyrie

title: q-bee
body:
A character from the [[Darkstalkers]] series.

Leader of the Soul Bees and Character in Capcom's Vampire/Darkstalker series.

She premiered in [b]Vampire Savior/Darkstalkers 3[/b], and is noted for her Homing Airdash being a very powerful tool. Uses a variety of moves highlighting her bee nature, including ES C->R, which Coccoons the enemy and a daughter hatches from it, +B, a move where she covers the foes in bees, and QJ, which coats the foe in a bubble of honey, preventing movement.

[b]Soul Bees[/b] are very simillar to Earth bees as far as Sex Roles and Society. The [[compound eyes]] and [[Antennae]] are the primary sensory organs. [b]Soul Bees[/b] take on a humanlike form and can mate with most creatures, as well as lure prey. A [b]Soul Bee[/b]'s intellect is comperable to a human 5 year old, and are driven heavily on instinct. Soul Bees are carnivorous and can eat niegh anything, dying if no food is consumed in 48 hours.

In story, the [b]Soul Bees[/b] inhabit the Doma lands of Makai, which has become barren over the years. When [[Jedah Dohma]] returns from death, they align with him to collect souls in exchange for being able to eat freely. In [[Q-Bee]]'s ending, she betrays [[Jedah Dohma]] to her instincts to eat, and the [b]Soul Bee[/b] population explodes, threatening overpopulation causing extinction.

[[Q-Bee]] also appears as Cards in the SVC: Card Fighters' Clash series, an enemy unit in NamcoXCapcom, and various [[Darkstalkers]] Adaptations in roles of various significance.

Not to be confused with the [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] character [[Kyubey]].

She is voiced by [i]Matsushita Miyuki[/i], but the only sounds the character makes are buzzes.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Q-Bee

title: jedah_dohma
body:
[b]Jedah Dohma (ジェダ・ドーマ)[/b] is a [[Darkstalkers]] character who first debuted in [b]Vampire Savior: The Lord of Vampire (a.k.a. Darkstalkers 3)[/b].

He is a Demon from Makai and is over 6000 years old, he is the youngest out of the three High nobles of Makai. He was always concerned about the future of Makai. He believed that if Makai was left to rule by Belial, the master of the Aensland family and the true ruler of Makai, then it would fall into chaos. Belial would most likely say that is destiny and life. To Jedah, Belial was a being who is not fit to rule. He looked for an opportunity to destroy Belial and waited for the right time to strike as a means to control the realm for himself. 

After a century long sleep, Jedah was revived in Makai. He felt concern towards the realm Makai, with nobles fighting each other. Instead of anger, he felt pity towards Ozomu. Jedah had already made up his mind: his complete revival and the cleansing of all souls. For this, a new stage was necessary. A new realm, the Majigen.

He is mainly known by his alias, Kimo Kimo.

title: fake_blood
body:
A substance that appears to be [[blood]], but isn't - in color artworks, commonly [[ketchup]], [[red bean paste]], [[jam]] or [[paint]]; though monochrome ones might also use other substances, like [[chocolate]].

Not every instance of a red fluid is necessarily faux blood - look for crazed expressions, knives, signs of "injuries", or people [[playing dead|lying lifelessly]] on the floor (with the source of "blood" visible).

h4. See also
* [[Ambiguous red liquid]] - when it cannot be determined if the liquid is blood or not

title: iyagatteru_kimi_ga_suki
body:
Ongoing webcomic based on [[oniyama831|Oniyama Mizuki]]'s [i][[Sonna Futari wa Tsukiatteiru]][/i] series of comics.
Roughly translated title: [i]To The Hateful You, I Like You.[/i]

Ootsuki Makoto confesses his feelings to Shirakawa Mikoto, and the two begin dating.

[spoiler]A story of mutual exploitation with multiple victims. Iyagatteru Kimi Ga Suki explores various fringe paraphilias and the psychology of the characters in detail as their most depraved feelings are exposed(while keeping things classy).[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Its prevailing spirit is an exploration of[i] a perversion of romantic emotions,[/i] rather than crass fringe sexual perversion for perversion's sake.[/spoiler]


80s styled [spoiler]arguably horror[/spoiler] romance written in the modern era [spoiler]with grotesque (guro) elements.[/spoiler]

Absolutely not your conventional [i]shoujo[/i] love story. Filled with dark and ironic humor.

[spoiler][i]How deep does the rabbit hole go?[/i][/spoiler]
other_names: 嫌がってるキミが好き

title: midnight_bliss
body:
The [b]Midnight Bliss[/b] ([b]ミッドナイトブリス[/b]) is a special move used by [[Demitri Maximoff]] from the [[darkstalkers|Vampire/Darkstalkers]] seires.

Demitri glides forward, tosses a rose at the opponent, transforms them into a hapless maiden ([b]including male characters![/b]), bows before them, holds them in the air, and then drains the life energy out of the opponent.

The move was very popular in the original game, but became even more popular when Demitri was put in [[SVC Chaos]] which forced the development team to make [[genderswap|genderswapped]] sprites for the male characters both from [[SNK]] and [[Capcom]]. A few years later Demitri was included in the roster for [[Capcom Fighting Jam]] which should be no surprise as to what happens next after that.

The move's name is also used a common tag on [[pixiv]] for genderswapping male characters that have or come from an official fighting game, or for drawing female characters as they are depicted from the original fighting games when under the effect of the Midnight Bliss.

h4. Midnight Bliss compilation videos

* [[darkstalkers|Vampire/Darkstalkers]]: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aOPNAB4C_uQ (Video was made private!)
* Darkstalkers Revenge: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eJls2jI6WHA
* Darkstalkers Resurrection: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ux_TzeaEAPk
* [[SVC Chaos]]: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iEZCqQLWznk and "Video 2":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sJtIk9z7TN0
* [[Capcom Fighting Jam|Capcom Fighting Evolution]]: YouTube "Video 1":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n2Lfg1NkPdk and "Video 2":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dAlSdsBDnJ8

An extra character from [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]].

A white unicorn with bright blue hair and sunglasses also known as DJ Pon3.

Fans tend to pair her with [[Octavia Melody]] because of their wildly divergent personalities and musical tastes, and they were seen living together in the background pony-oriented hundredth episode.

title: star_trek:_the_next_generation
body:
Star Trek: The Next Generation (TNG) is an American science fiction television series created by Gene Roddenberry. It originally aired from September 28, 1987, to May 23, 1994, in syndication, spanning 178 episodes over seven seasons. The third series in the [[Star Trek]] franchise, it was inspired by [[Star Trek: The Original Series]]. Set in the latter third of the 24th century, when Earth is part of the United Federation of Planets, it follows the adventures of a Starfleet starship, the [[USS Enterprise]] (NCC-1701-D), in its exploration of the Alpha quadrant in the Milky Way galaxy.

The Next Generation featured a new crew: [[Patrick Stewart]] as Captain [[Jean-Luc Picard]], Jonathan Frakes as [[William Riker]], Brent Spiner as Data, Michael Dorn as [[worf (star trek)|Worf]], LeVar Burton as [[Geordi La Forge]], Marina Sirtis as [[Deanna Troi]], Gates McFadden as Dr. [[Beverly Crusher]], Denise Crosby as Tasha Yar, Wil Wheaton as Wesley Crusher, and a new Enterprise.

Source: Wikipedia.

title: sturmabteilung
body:
[i]Sturmabteilung[/i] (German for "Storm Division") was the original paramilitary wing of the [[Nazi|Nazi Party]] that played a significant role in [[Adolf Hitler]]'s rise to power in 1920s and 1930s. Its members were largely purged and their leader [[ernst julius roehm|Ernst Röhm]], was executed during the Night of the Long Knives, superseded by the [[Waffen-SS|Schutzstaffel]] despite SA continued to exist until 1945.

The SA were colloquially called Brownshirts ([i]Braunhemden[/i]) due to the color of their uniform's shirts.

h4. Uniform and insignia
Their standard [[uniform]] consisted of a [[kepi]], [[brown shirt|brown]] [[collared shirt]] paired with a [[brown necktie]], [[brown jacket|brown]] [[military jacket]], [[Sam Browne belt]], [[brown pants]] or [[jodhpurs]], and a pair of [[boots]].
The SA [[insignia]] consisted of a [[badge]] ([[Nazi party pin]]), [[collar tabs]], [[shoulder boards]], [[cuff title]], and the [[Iron Cross]]. The [[red armband|red]] party [[armband]] were often donned as well.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Sturmabteilung":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sturmabteilung

title: russian_liberation_army
body:
The [b]Russian Liberation Army[/b] (German: [i]Russische Befreiungsarmee[/i]; Russian: Русская освободительная армия, abbreviated as РОА) was a pro-Axis [[military]] formation, primarily composed of [[Russia]]ns, that fought under German command during [[World War II]]. Active from 1942 until 1945, the [[soldier|army]] was led by a defected Soviet Army general, Andrey Vlasov.

The personnel were distinguishable by the [[shoulder patch]]es bearing the blue saltire on white background design of the [[St. Andrew's Flag]] (Russian Naval Jack), [[ushanka]]s, [[cockade]]s on [[military hat]]s that bear the white-blue-red [[russian flag|Russian tricolor]] or sometimes such stripes that were painted on their [[Stahlhelm]]e.

h4. See also

title: floating_dock
body:
A floating dock is coastal/water structure composed of a platform kept afloat using pontoons and anchored, similar to a [[pier]] but is able to rise and lower with the tide.  May have a gangway used to connect it to the shore.

A structure built upon similar platforms are called a [[floating home]].

h4. See also

* [[Jetty]]
* [[Wharf]]
* [[Dock]]
* [[Harbor]]
* [[Port]]
* [[Ship]]

title: seawall
body:
A seawall is a coastal defense structure, a structure to protect against flooding and erosion, built along the coast.  May be as simple as large rocks and debris lining the coastline or it may be an actual wall built along the coast line.  In Japan [[tetrapod]]s are commonly used for seawalls.

h4. See also

* [[Breakwater]]
* "Wikipedia: Seawall":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seawall]

title: split_theme
body:
Multiple distinct (and usually opposite) themes being represented at the same time, with a [[split_theme|split]] between them as a way to represent contrast. 

The simplest way to do this is to have two opposite themes on each side with a clean split in the middle (see [[split screen]]).

Examples:

* Two different characters being portrayed as one (post #1318355)
* While a character is in the middle of a [[henshin]] transformation (post #1841349)
* Revealing the "true nature" of a character (post #6870337)
* Comparing how a character looked when they were younger to when they're older

h4. See Also
* [[juxtaposition]]
* [[polar opposites]]
* [[sword in front of face]]

title: breakwater
body:
A breakwater is a long coastal structure out in the water that runs parallel to the shore.  They're normal feature of man-made [[harbor]]s to break the force of the sea and to provide shelter for vessels lying inside.

h4. See also

* [[Seawall]]
* [[Tetrapod]]

title: pier
body:
A coastal structure composed of raised platforms supported by piles or posts, similar to a one-ended bridge extending out into the water.  May be used as a simple walkway, support structures over the water, or to moor ships and boats.  Commonly made of wood, but may also be made of other materials such as metal or stone.

h4. See Also

* [[Floating dock]]
* [[Jetty]]
* [[Wharf]]
* [[Dock]]
* [[Harbor]]
* [[Port]]
* [[Ship]]

title: wharf
body:
A solid coastal structure running along the coastline where boats and ships may moor.  May have [[pier]]s and [[jetty]] extending out into the water from them.

h4. See Also

* [[Floating dock]]
* [[Dock]]
* [[Harbor]]
* [[Port]]
* [[Ship]]

title: jetty
body:
A solid coastal structure typically composed of stone, fill, and/or wood that juts out into the water.  May be used to moor ships and boats or to alter the coastal current.  Unlike a [[pier]] these structures completely block the flow of water.

h4. See also

* [[Breakwater]]
* [[Floating dock]]
* [[Wharf]]
* [[Dock]]
* [[Harbor]]
* [[Port]]
* [[Ship]]
* [[Tag group:locations]]

title: chemical_structure
body:
A graphical representation of the [[chemistry|chemical]] compound's spatial arrangement of its atoms, molecular shape and often their chemical bonds. It comes in various models and can be either 2D or 3D. Unlike [[chemical formula]] which is limited to text.

For example, the chemical structure for water (H₂O) is a basic grid of one hydrogen molecule, one oxygen, and then another hydrogen. More complex substances thus require more complicated grids to outline every molecule present.

h4. Examples
* !post #4678960: Ball and stick model of the sulfur mustard.
* !post #362186: Skeletal structure of adenine with a benzene ring.

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Chemical structure":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chemical_structure

title: chemical_formula
body:
A way of presenting information about the [[chemistry|chemical]] proportions of atoms that constitute a particular [[chemicals|chemical]] compound or molecule, using chemical element symbols, numbers, and sometimes also other symbols, such as parentheses, dashes, brackets, and plus (+) and minus (−) signs. Unlike [[chemical structure]], these are limited to a single typographic line of symbols, which may include subscripts and superscripts. 

For example, H₂O for [[water]] and C₇H₅N₃O₆ or C₆H₂(NO₂)₃CH₃ for [[tnt|trinitrotoluene]].

title: chemical_symbol
body:
To be used for posts that depict individual or assorted chemical symbols of certain elements. Not to be used for the whole [[periodic table]] or [[chemical formula]].

Some examples are H for hydrogen, Ag for silver ([i]argentum[/i]), Ba for barium, Br for bromine, and so on.

title: mercury_(element)
body:
An element with the [[chemical symbol|symbol]] [b]Hg[/b] ([i]hydrargyrum[/i]) and its atomic number is 80. It appears as a dense, silvery-white fluid with a mirror-like appearance. Mercury is the only metal with [[liquid]] form at room temperature. It is poisonous and [[pollution|harmful to the environment]].

For the planet, see [[Mercury (planet)]].

title: asymmetrical_bangs
body:
A hairstyle where half the bangs is worn combed back / short, and the other half long resulting in a distinctly asymmetric hairstyle.  

Examples include [[Sakurazaki Setsuna]] from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]] and [[Misaka Mikoto]] and her variants from [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]].  

This tag should not be used for bangs asymmetric simply due to a part on one side, for that see either [[parted bangs]] or [[swept bangs]].

* !post #4575471
* !post #7624424

h4. See also

* [[bangs|bangs list]]
* [[blunt bangs]] - For straight-cut unparted bangs
* [[diagonal bangs]] - For bangs that are cut in an odd diagonal line
* [[swept bangs]] - For bangs loosely combed to one side
* [[parted bangs]] - For distinctly parted bangs
* [[crossed bangs]] - For bangs that criss-cross each other on the forehead
* [[hair over eyes]] - For long bangs that cover the eyes
* [[hair over one eye]] - The same as the above, but asymmetric

title: roma_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Roma[/i]. Character design by [[Chyoel]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[yellow eyes|yellow]] eyes. Her default outfit consists of a long [[white dress]] with a studded [[see-through dress|see-through]] outer layer, white [[detached sleeves]], a [[red cape]], a [[gold]] [[belt]] with a [[dagger]] attached to it, an [[Italian flag]] ribbon on the cape, a [[mini crown]], and other pieces of [[jewelry]] like [[bracelet]]s.

Her [[rigging]] is similar to [[Roma (Kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]], sporting two of her historic 381 mm triple mounts (one on each side) with additional 20 mm twin mounts atop the turrets, and two of her 152 mm triple mounts, all in rigs that display the [[Regia Marina]]'s historic red-white bow marks and shields that display the [[Sardegna Empire (emblem)|]] emblem. She is also shown carrying a gold [[staff]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5543778: Default
* !post #5674564: [[Roma (White Heron of Darkest Night) (Azur Lane)|White Heron of Darkest Night]]
* !post #7908742: [[Roma (Vacation Upon the Tiber) (Azur Lane)|Vacation Upon the Tiber]]

h4. History
Historically, she never saw much action due to chronic fuel shortages by the time she was commissioned in June 1942. Roma was sunk by the [[Luftwaffe]] in her only combat stint as she, her sister ships [[Vittorio Veneto (Azur Lane)|]] and [[Littorio (Azur Lane)|]], and other units in the Italian fleet that could sortie attempted to sail to Malta to surrender to the British in early September 1943.

h4. [i]Vittorio Veneto[/i]-class battleships

* [[Vittorio Veneto (Azur Lane)|]]
* [[Littorio (Azur Lane)|]]
* [[Impero (Azur Lane)|]] (converted to carrier)
* [b]Roma[/b]

h4. See also

* [[Roma (Kancolle)]]
* [[Roma (Warship Girls R)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Italian battleship [i]Roma[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_battleship_Roma_(1940)]

title: idolmaster_side-m
body:
A mobile game spin-off of [[idolmaster|iDOLM@STER]] launched in 2014, this time focusing on producing for the male idols of the 315 Productions agency. 

The members of [[jupiter (idolmaster)|Jupiter]] from [[Idolmaster 2|iDOLM@STER 2]]'s 961 Productions are included in the roster, with Akizuki Ryou of [[idolmaster dearly stars|Dearly Stars]]' 876 Productions being added later as part of his own unit.

In March 2015, voices began to be introduced for the idols, starting with the unit DRAMATIC STARS. ST@RTING LINE, a series of music CDs featuring them and other units, also began to be released by Lantis throughout the year. 

In December 2015, a Twitter-based poll called the New Idol Discovery Project (新アイドル発掘オーディション) was run to select three new idols from a pool of nine candidates to form a new unit, with the winners being announced a month later. The winners (Amehiko, Koron, and Sora) were later implemented into the game in July 2016 as the idol group Legenders. The other six candidates have not been put into the game as of late.

In February 2017, Bandai Namco announced the development of [[idolmaster_side-m_live_on_stage!|The iDOLM@STER SideM Live on St@ge!]], a mobile spinoff. The game serves as a male counterpart to [[idolmaster_cinderella_girls_starlight_stage|Starlight Stage]], as it is a rhythm game utilizing 3D models of the 315 idols for in-game performances. They also announced a [i]SideM[/i] anime adaptation, with further details being revealed on "315 Day" (March 15). The anime premiered in the fall of 2017.

In 2021, a third game, [[idolmaster side-m growing stars|THE iDOLM@STER SideM GROWING STARS]], was announced following the closure of [i]LIVE ON ST@GE![/i].

title: mai_(senran_kagura)
body:
A playable character from the [[Senran Kagura]] videogame series. She makes her debut in [[Senran Kagura New Wave]].

A member of the idol group Milky Pop and a 2nd-year high school student. She often acts without considering the consequences, she was unexpectedly scouted and became an idol. She's pleased with her current situation in which many people love her, however, to continue being a ninja student, her true identity is kept a secret. Being both a ninja and an idol, she is carrying out a very reckless dream. Wielding a microphone stand model training sword, she carries out slashing attacks.

title: bai_winchester
body:
[[Closers]] character.

Closer of Wildhüter who uses the Blade of the Ice, which has the power of Dimensionals imbued into it. After a certain incident, Bai joins UNION with conviction to save who is important to her, fighting Dimensionals in her way. Creating alluring forms of ice together with the sword skills of her clan of assassins, she will now work not as an assassin, but as Closer who protects the people.

title: hakase_satomi
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 24 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Robotics Club and Jet Propulsion Club. She is the creator of [[karakuri chachamaru|Chachamaru]], and always working to upgrade her. She is very intelligent and quite obsessive when it comes to her work.

She is very close to [[Chao Lingshen]].

She wears [[glasses]] and has [[grey eyes]] with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] worn in low [[twin braids]] with [[antenna hair]]. She has a large [[forehead]].

title: zazie_rainyday
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 31 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Acrobatics Club and Magic Club, and is the silent and mysterious girl of 2/3 A. She rarely associates with her fellow classmates; though she takes company in odd black spirits that appear around Mahora Academy.

She is often seen passing the time by juggling.

She has [[dark skin]], [[red eyes]], and [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with long [[sidelocks]]. She has two [[facial mark]]s: a [[teardrop facial mark|teardrop]] under her left eye, and a vertical line on the right side of her face.

title: hasegawa_chisame
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 25 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is perceived as a very reserved person, also very unsocial and very grumpy. She is not afraid to express her annoyance with others, particularly her classmates.

She has great computer skills; which she uses when she becomes the "[i]Legendary Net Idol, Chiu! (ちう!)[/i]":/post/show/2047, who is a happy, energetic [[cosplay]]ing girl. Besides her other self, Chisame surprisingly lacks confidence in her own looks.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] reddish [[brown hair]] kept in a [[low ponytail]]. She wears [[glasses]].

title: narutaki_fumika
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 23 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class; and the younger sister of the [[Narutaki Fuuka|Narutaki]] twins. She's almost the complete opposite in personality to her sister; though she will play pranks, because she is dragged along. She is also in the Strolling Club and Beautification Club.

She also enjoys playing Ninja and taking lessons from [[nagase kaede|Kaede]], but her ninjutsu is clearly low. And the lessons the girls are learning is not real ninjutsu.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[orange hair]] in [[double bun]]s.

title: narutaki_fuuka
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 22 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class; and the older sister of the [[Narutaki Fumika|Narutaki]] twins. She's the mischievous one and likes to play pranks on other people. She is also in the Strolling Club.

She also enjoys playing Ninja and taking lessons from [[nagase kaede|Kaede]], but her ninjutsu is clearly low. And the lessons the girls are learning is not real ninjutsu.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[orange hair]] in [[twintails]].

title: naba_chizuru
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 21 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Astronomy Club and also volunteers at a Day Care, so she is a very motherly and kind person. Though she has been described as "strange".

She has [[brown eyes]] (with a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]]) and [[long hair|long]] [[red hair|reddish]] [[brown hair]] with two long [[sidelocks]] in spirals.

title: yukihiro_ayaka
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 29 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is the wealthy class representative for Class 2/3 A, who keeps the class in order. She is also skilled in the martial arts.

She has an odd rivalry and friendship with [[kagurazaka asuna|Asuna]], and cares deeply for [[negi springfield|Negi]]; which her classmates see as unhealthy and 'obsessive'.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with long [[sidelocks]].

title: saotome_haruna
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 14 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Library Exploration Club and Manga Club. She is the creator of an original manga: "Mahou Shoujo Bibulion" or Biblion; going by the pen name Paru (Pal).

If there is a rumor going around, it is likely Haruna that started it, since she can be quite mischievous.

She has [[brown eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[antenna hair]], and wears [[glasses]].

title: shiina_sakurako
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 17 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a Mahora Cheerleader and in the squad with [[kugimiya madoka|Madoka]] and [[kakizaki misa|Misa]]. She is very outgoing, positive and hyper. She is described as having great luck, so she has no problems gambling.

She enjoys [[karaoke]] and shopping with her friends.

She has [[brown eyes]] and  [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[orange hair]] worn in [[twintails]], with [[twin braids]] in back.

title: kugimiya_madoka
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 11 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a Mahora Cheerleader and in the squad with [[shiina sakurako|Sakurako]] and [[kakizaki misa|Misa]].

Seems to be the most serious out of the three but knows when to have fun, she sticks up for her friends despite their antics. She has a complex about her husky voice. And she likes Silver accessories and Western Music.

She has [[black eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]].

title: yotsuba_satsuki
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 30 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Cooking Club and is the Lunch Rep. She works at the Chao Bao Zi Chinese restaurant cart with [[KuFei]] and [[Chao Lingshen]], along with [[Hakase Satomi]] and [[karakuri chachamaru|Chachamaru]]. One of her life goals is to be a Chef and have her own restaurant.

She is greatly admired by Mahora, and has [[evangeline a.k. mcdowell|Eva's]] highest respects. She likes to make people happy with her food.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] in [[short twintails]]. She is noticeably the most [[plump]] student in the class.

title: murakami_natsumi_(negima)
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 28 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. Although she is shy, she is in the Theatrical Club as an actress. She is self conscious about her appearance (considers herself underdeveloped), and is jealous of others' appearances.

Although forced into the role of older sister to [[Inugami Kotarou]], she gradually takes to it, and is quite protective of him.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] with [[freckles]] on her cheeks.

title: sasaki_makie
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 16 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in [[Rhythmic Gymnastics]] and has great skills with the gymnastics ribbon. She is quoted as being "Child like" and lacking mental strength, making her the second when it comes to low scores.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] worn in high [[short twintails]].

She is "Baka Pink" in the [[mahora_baka_rangers|Baka Rangers]] study group.

title: konoe_konoka
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 13 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is Granddaughter to the Dean of Mahora Academy. Coming from a family line of Mage's, she has tremendous magical potential. Fortune telling and the supernatural being some her favorite things.

She is close friends with [[kagurazaka asuna|Asuna]], and also with her childhood protector [[Sakurazaki Setsuna]]. Konoka's personality can be described as very cheerful and optimistic.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]].

title: sakurazaki_setsuna
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 15 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a "hanyou" (half demon, half human) being. She is a [[kendo]] expert of the shinmei-ryu of fighting and has some knowledge of onmyoujutsu. She wields a [[ootachi]].

Loyal guardian and friend to [[Konoe Konoka]]. She gradually became close to her classmates.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] up in a [[side ponytail]]. Due to her mixed heritage, she has a form of [[albino|albinism]], and a pair of white [[feathered wings]].

title: inugami_kotarou
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

He is a "hanyou" (half demon, half human) being. He is a good friend an rival to [[Negi Springfield]].

He lives with [[Naba Chizuru]], [[Murakami Natsumi (negima)|]], and [[Yukihiro Ayaka]]. His obvious and notable features are his [[dog ears]] and [[dog tail]].

title: ayase_yue
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 4 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a member of the Library Exploration Group. She is often seen drinking unusual beverages from juice boxes, unfortunately this leads to restroom trips. 

Despite her love of reading she actually gets low grades, due to dislike of studying. She is close friends with [[Miyazaki Nodoka]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair|purple]] [[twintails]] and [[purple eyes]].

She is "Baka Black" in the [[mahora_baka_rangers|Baka Rangers]] study group.

title: izumi_ako
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 5 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She works in the Nurses Office as an assistant. Despite this and her helpful nature, she is terrified of blood and very shy.

She develops a crush on a character named Nagi (which is really Negi), but thinks Nagi is Negi's cousin.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[light blue hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She has a large [[scar]] on her back, which she is very self-conscious about.

title: kakizaki_misa
body:
Character From [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 7 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a Mahora Cheerleader and she's in the Chorus Club. It is said that she is the only girl in class to have a steady boyfriend.

She likes karaoke and shopping with her friends, [[shiina_sakurako|Sakurako]] and [[kugimiya madoka|Madoka]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]].

title: kasuga_misora
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 9 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Track and Field Club, and is revealed to be a Mage-in-training. She always wears a [[crucifix]] and is sometimes seen wearing a [[nun]] habit.

She appears reluctant to get involved in confrontations and is self-conscious about her magic ability: a pair of sneakers that give her speed and agility, the Joculatrix Monachans.

She has [[very short hair|very short]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]].

title: cahciua
body:
Character in  in [i][[Final Fantasy XIV]][/i]: [i]Dawntrail[/i].

[[Erenville]]'s mother and mentor. She calls him her 'fussy little bun-bun' due to his sullen nature as a child. It was this nature that prompted her to push him to be a gleaner, hoping that seeing the world and meeting new people would improve his disposition.

At the time of [i]Dawntrail[/i], she has become the leader of the covert organization Oblivion, leading it remotely via an [[outrunner_(ffxiv)|Outrunner]] drone.

[spoilers]It is later revealed that she had died during the 30-year timeskip following Alexandria's incursion. The Outrunner was being controlled by a simulacrum built from her stored memories, one of many Endless caught in limbo in Living Memory. Her ultimate goal was to be released along with the other Endless, allowing all of them to finally pass on.[/spoilers]

title: karakuri_chachamaru
body:
A character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]]. An [[android]] girl.

Seat 10 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a robot created by [[Hakase Satomi]] (and possibly [[Chao Lingshen]]) to serve [[evangeline a.k. mcdowell|Evangeline]] and protect her. She is in the [[Go (board game)|]] Club and the Tea Ceremony Club. She is very skilled in hand combat and weaponry.

Chachamaru functions by a combination of technology and magic.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]].

title: asakura_kazumi
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 3 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is the resident class Reporter and works for the Mahora newspaper, she will go to great lengths to get a huge scoop.

It is rare to see Kazumi without a camera. She becomes friends with the class ghost - [[Aisaka Sayo]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] bright [[red hair]] in a bushy [[ponytail]].

title: miyazaki_nodoka
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 27 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She helps at the Mahora Library and bookstore, and is a part of the Reader's Club and Library Exploration Club. She is very passive and shy; one of her best friends is [[Ayase Yue]].

She develops a crush on [[Negi Springfield|Negi]], and is the second (after [[kagurazaka asuna|Asuna]]) to have a provisionary contract with him.

She has chin length [[blue hair]] and she later ties her hair in a [[ponytail]].

title: akashi_yuuna
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 2 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Sports Club and plays [[basketball]].

She is shown to have a great love for her father, Professor Akashi. And has a great dislike of any woman who appears to be getting close to him.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] in a [[side ponytail]].

title: aisaka_sayo
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 1 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a shy ghost who died 60 years before the series started. For some time she was unable to be seen or interact with anyone.

As a ghost she has white hair, red eyes, and a pale appearance. She wears a traditional sailor style [[school uniform]].

She befriends classmate [[Asakura Kazumi]].

title: erenville
body:
Character in  in [i][[Final Fantasy XIV]][/i]. Introduced briefly in [i]Endwalker[/i], before playing a more major role in [i]Dawntrail[/i].

A gleaner for Sharlyan, specializing in the procurement of animal specimens. Originally from a small village in Tural, where he was raised (and trained) by his mother [[Cahciua]]. A friend of [[Wuk Lamat]] since childhood, he grudgingly agrees to accompany her on the Rite of Succession.

title: continental_magic_association_receptionist_(sousou_no_frieren)
body:
A minor female character in [[Sousou no Frieren]]. She acts as the receptionist for the northern branch of the Continental Magic Association in Äußerst. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] in a [[bob cut]] and [[blue eyes]] and typically wears [[glasses]] and a [[beret]].

title: zi-apollo_(code_geass)
body:
[b]UZZ-001s Zi-Apollo[/b]

A [[Knightmare frame]] from [[Code Geass: Dakkan no Roze]] operated by the Nameless Mercenaries. A High maneuverable KMF developed for close combat equipped with six 'Slash Harkens', two [[arm blade]]s and the Blaze Luminous ([[energy shield]]) system. Painted primarily in dark blue, red and silver, piloted by [[Ash Phoenix]]. The real life mechanical designer of Zi-Apollo is Junichi Akutsu (BEE-CRAFT).

Zi-Apollo can enter a boosted performance mode by lowering an [[assault visor]], it can also combine with the [[Zi-Artemis (code geass)|]] and form the [[Zi-Ortygia (code geass)|]] unit.

title: sumeragi_sakuya
body:
The protagonist of [[Code Geass]] [[code_geass:_dakkan_no_roze|Dakkan no Roze]] under the fake identity of [[Roze (code geass)|]]. Voiced by [[Ueda Reina]].

An heir to both the Britannian Imperial family as well as the Sumeragi family of Kyoto house, her [[Geass]] is the power of absolute obedience, given through vocal commands.

When she is out of her disguise, Sakuya has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] in a [[hime cut]] style, her eyes are [[pink eyes|pink]], wears a [[metal collar]] that suppresses her Geass as well as changes her voice when disguised as Roze.

h4. See also
* [[Roze (code geass)|]] <tn>Disguise persona</tn>
* [[Ash Phoenix]]
* [[Haruyanagininomiya Sakura]] <tn>Identical looking body double</tn>
